description:
A once thrived kingdom, Yin—now governed by an evil hermit, Dakki, and her party—is in a chaotic status with its people suffering Dakki’s oppressions. Seeing this, The Hermit Band took it seriously and planned a "Houshin Plan" which is assigned to an apprentice hermit, Taikoubou, who gathered partners, captured and sealed all evil hermits, and planned to establish a new kingdom. On the other hand, the strongest and an Yin- royal hermit, Bunchuu, stood up against Taikoubou to protect the old kingdom with all his might. Thus, the death battle among invincible hermits begins...

(Source: Crunchyroll)

title.native: 覇穹 封神演義 スペシャル・エピソード「黄家の血」

node.description:
__Ryu Fujisaki__ is a Japanese mangaka born in Former Kawauchi Town (now Mutsu), Aomori Prefecture. He made his professional manga debut with WORLDS in 1990.
Fujisaki won the 39th and the 40th Tezuka Award, first with the uncompiled one shot Hameln no Fuefuki (ハメルンの笛吹き) and later with WORLDS.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋ナツコ)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/193091/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nocturamayama)

Yamashita graduated from Kokugakuin University with a Major in History. He first started out in the industry in 1997 as a production assistant at JCF. Amazingly, he has never been formally trained in art. His talent for drawing was first discovered through various doodles and sketches he would make on company paperwork.

Yamashita's first project as an animator was on [the second Kochikame movie](https://anilist.co/anime/3547/). Some time later he went freelance. [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/) was the first project he worked on freelance. Around 2006, Yamashita joined [Bee Train](https://anilist.co/studio/5/) and started work as character designer and animation director on the TV show [Ginyuu Mokushiroku Meine Liebe Wieder](https://anilist.co/anime/771/). A short while later, the animation department at Bee Train was spun off into new company, [C-Station](https://anilist.co/studio/6074/), and Yamashita moved with it. Today he retains a seat at C-Station, but regularly contracts out to work on various external projects.

name.first: Fear, and Loathing in Las Vegas
name.native: フィアー·アンド·ロージング·イン·ラスベガス

node.description:
[Website](http://www.lasvegas-jp.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Falilv) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/Falilv_Official/)

__Biography__
The band formed in 2008 in Kobe, Japan. Fear, and Loathing in Las Vegas combines electronica and metalcore, further exploring a number of influences from other genres among their discography. The singing is comprised of twin vocals; the destructive shouts of one vocalist contrasts with the autotune of the other, which gives them a presence like no other. In November 2009, their first EP "Burn the Disco Floor with Your 2-step!!" was released.

__Members__
- So - vocal, scream vocal, programming (joined in 2009)
- Minami - vocal, scream vocal, keyboard, programming
- Taiki - guitar, chorus, vocal
- Tomonori - drums
- Tetsuya - bass, chorus, vocal (joined in 2019)

__Former Members__
- Mashu - bass (left on September 21, 2013)
- Sxun - guitar, chorus, vocal (left on June 30, 2018)
- Kei - bass, chorus, vocal (died on January 12, 2019)

__[Website](http://yanaginagi.net/) | [Personal Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanaginagi) | [Professional Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanaginagi_info)__

__Introduction:__
yanaginagi, alternatively known as Gazelle, or otherwise simply known as nagi, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger under record label NBC Universal. She is known for performing as a guest singer for the band [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell) under the name nagi from 2009-2011.

__Biography:__
During her childhood, she first became interested in music with the help of an electronic organ her mother received from the neighboring residents. She would go on to start composing music during Junior High School using DTM (Desktop Music) software her brother had bought.

In 2006, as a 19 year old, she would start making her indie debut by posting songs to the music site Player's Kingdom, where she would go on to produce many original songs. She has also posted songs to the video sharing site Nico Nico Douga under the name Gazelle, and participated as one of the singers in "Lantis Suite feat. Nico Nico Artists". During her stay at Nico Nico Douga, she would at one point come in contact with [ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109941/ryo), the leader of supercell, which eventually led her to start working with him. A couple of years later in March 2008, she would retire from music activites on the site Nico Nico Douga.

On February 29, 2012, she would make her major debut by releasing the single "[Vidro Moyou](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7_iMfWt1hA8)" through Geneon Universal.

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%84%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8E%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8E), edited)
